rules.title: Character Basics
rules.content: Your character is defined by their attributes, skills, and background. Start by choosing a concept and then distribute your attribute points.

rules.title: Character Attributes
rules.content: Attributes represent your character's innate capabilities. The six primary attributes are: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. You have 27 points to distribute among these attributes.

rules.title: Character Skills
rules.content: Skills represent trained abilities. Choose 4 skills from the list to be proficient in. Your skill bonus is your proficiency bonus plus the relevant attribute modifier.

rules.title: Combat Basics
rules.content: Combat is resolved in rounds. Each round, every participant gets one turn in initiative order. On your turn, you can move up to your speed and take one action.

rules.title: Making Attacks
rules.content: To make an attack, roll 1d20 and add your attack bonus. If the result meets or exceeds the target's defense, your attack hits. Roll damage dice and add your damage bonus.

rules.title: Defense
rules.content: Your defense value is 10 plus your Dexterity modifier plus your armor bonus. This is the number attackers must meet or exceed to hit you.

rules.title: Magic Basics
rules.content: Magic is powered by spell slots. Each spell has a level from 1 to 9. To cast a spell, you must expend a spell slot of the spell's level or higher.

rules.title: Learning Spells
rules.content: Spellcasters learn spells based on their class. Wizards learn from study, Clerics receive them through prayer, and Sorcerers know them innately.

rules.title: Spell Components
rules.content: Most spells require verbal (V), somatic (S), or material (M) components. You must be able to speak for verbal components, have a free hand for somatic components, and possess the materials for material components.
